conclusion: Shadows are cast in the direction opposite to the light source.
If the light source moves to the back right, the shadows will shift to the front left relative to the objects.
The size of a shadow depends on the distance between the light source and the object.
If the light source moves farther away, the shadows may become smaller and more diffused.
If the light source moves closer, the shadows may become larger and sharper.
The shape of the shadow depends on the geometry of the object casting it.
The shape of the shadow remains consistent unless the angle of the light changes significantly.
The shadow of the apple is circular and positioned slightly to the left of the apple.
When the light source moves to the back right, the shadow of the apple will shift to the front left.
The shadow of the apple may become slightly smaller or larger depending on the distance of the light source, but the circular shape will remain consistent.
The shadow of the white flag is rectangular and positioned to the left of the flag.
The shadow of the white flag will shift to the front left when the light source moves to the back right.
The shadow of the white flag may become slightly smaller or larger depending on the light source's distance, but the rectangular shape will remain consistent.
The shadow of the glass is faint and irregular, positioned to the left of the glass.
The shadow of the glass will shift to the front left when the light source moves to the back right.
The faint and diffused nature of the shadow of the glass will remain, but its position will change.
The shadow of the chicken leg is elongated and positioned to the left of the chicken leg.
The shadow of the chicken leg will shift to the front left when the light source moves to the back right.
The elongated shape of the shadow of the chicken leg will remain consistent, but the shadow may become slightly smaller or larger depending on the light source's distance.
All shadows (A, B, C, and D) will shift to the front left relative to their respective objects when the light source moves to the back right.
The size of the shadows may slightly increase or decrease depending on the distance of the light source.
